media.snippet: Grace is already under serious police investigation after being implicated in the smuggling of the country's ivory stocks, with several other ongoing probes said to be targeting the former first lady in the offing. While it has not been publicly confirmed, the Daily News has it on good authority that Mugabe has been personally assured of his immunity from prosecution for all the crimes that he may have committed during his tenure in office. However, it is believed that this blanket immunity does not cover the much-disliked Grace who made many enemies both in and out of Zanu PF while her husband was in power.
media.title: 'Mugabe running out of time' – Government – The Zimbabwe Mail

media.snippet: - The Zimbabwe Mail Lawyer says case against Undenge is a "circus" as Undenge and Mzembi are remanded to 22 January Two former Zimbabwean cabinet minister who served under ex-president Robert Mugabe have been charged with corruption, their lawyers said today, the latest crackdown on officials loyal to Mugabe. Mugabe, 93, stood down in November last year after 37 years in power following a de facto military coup, making way for his for deputy Emmerson Mnangagwa to take over.
media.title: Lawyer says case against Undenge is a "circus" as Undenge and Mzembi are remanded to 22 January – The Zimbabwe Mail

media.snippet: he asked, triggering applause in the hall as two junior US diplomats listened expressionless. Mugabe has tense relations with Western nations which have imposed sanctions to press for more democracy in Zimbabwe, where he has ruled for 37 years. Join the conversation!

media.title: Mnangagwa rejects Mugabe's claim that election is not free – The Zimbabwe Mail

media.snippet: | Mugabe 's machinations Any day now, Zimbabwe's highest court is expected to hand Robert Gabriel Mugabe five more years to add to the 33 spent at the helm of his country. Four years after the bloodshed of the previous elections resulted in an internationally brokered unity government comprising Mr. Mugabe's ZANU-PF party and the Movement for Democratic Change (MDC), the President has delivered a largely peaceful if not entirely credible election.
media.title: Mugabe's machinations | ZimDaily

media.snippet: He said in the past the army had stopped an uprising by MDC-T. The army was accused of using violence to campaign for Mugabe ahead of a run-off election in 2008, where first-round winner Morgan Tsvangirai, was forced to withdraw after his supporters were killed. Political analyst Alois Masepe said the comments by Sanyatwe showed that there was panic within the ruling elite and among securocrats as they did not know who was backing Mujuru.
media.title: Mujuru rattles the Generals | ZimDaily

media.snippet: Zimbabwe state media reported Friday morning a military statement saying talks with Mugabe "on the way forward" are ongoing. The Zimbabwe Defense Forces said "significant progress has been made in their operation to weed out criminals around President Mugabe," adding that they had arrested some although others were still at large. The statement said Zimbabwe's military is "currently engaging with the Commander-in-Chief President Robert Mugabe on the way forward and will advise the nation of the outcome as soon as possible."
media.title: PICS: Mugabe attends university graduation in 1st public event since military takeover | News24

media.title: This one's for you, Bob Marley | The Sunday Mail

media.snippet: It came after the army seized power in the country in what the leader of the African Union said looked like a "coup ". Mr Mugabe is being detained in the presidential palace, where explosions and gunshots were heard early on Wednesday. The army said it was holding the president and his wife Grace, but there have also been rumours she had fled to Namibia.
media.title: Tsvangirai returns to Zimbabwe for possible role in transitional government – The Zimbabwe Mail

media.snippet: Several elections under Mugabe saw rigging and violence as his ruling Zanu-PF party clung onto power. The winner faces the task of putting Zimbabwe back on track after 37 years under Mugabe, tainted by corruption, mismanagement and diplomatic isolation that caused a crisis in a country that once had one of Africa 's most promising economies. Reuters
media.title: Vote was fair, first results due from 3pm – ZEC – The Zimbabwe Mail

media.snippet: Cobus van Staden, a senior foreign policy researcher at the South African Institute of International Affairs, says, "Several ZANU-PF senior leaders were trained in China, including Emmerson Mnangagwa, the new president." He says the Mugabe regime's bonds with China grew stronger after the United States instituted financial sanctions in the early 2000s in response to Zimbabwe's human rights violations. Van Staden says the Chinese were "very visible" in Zimbabwe under Mugabe.
media.title: Was China A Catalyst for Political Change in Zimbabwe? – The Zimbabwe Mail

media.snippet: He said that Yugosl avia had stood by his movement to the end and had always been there to give help for his guerrilla struggle whenever he had asked for it. This is why Zimbabwe told the whole world that it would stand by Yugoslavia and would not permit that a country that assisted Zimbabwe and all other liberation movements in Souther n Africa should be exposed to sanctions which Zimbabwe saw as unjust, Mugabe said. He stressed that Zimbabwe had been defending this position, too, when it opposed the accession of Bosnia-Herzegovina to the Non-Aligned Movement at the recent summit in Columbia.
media.title: Yugoslav Daily Survey 96-06-12

media.snippet: In the petition, Mugadza wrote that the pope should "excommunicate Mugabe". He accused Mugabe of presiding over a government that "has caused unimaginable levels of poverty" in the southern African nation. Mugadza further said that the veteran leader had refused to leave office "despite his advance age of 92-years".
media.title: Zim cleric 'petitions Pope Francis to excommunicate Mugabe' | News24

media.snippet: As decisões do juiz foram rapidamente criticadas por especialistas em leis e direitos humanos e por aliados próximos de Mugabe e da mulher. Os militares do Zimbábue enviaram tanques para as ruas durante a noite em 14 de Novembro, assumindo o controle da emissora estatal e anunciando que Robert Mugabe estava em prisão domiciliária. O movimento militar levou o partido no poder a voltar-se contra Mugabe, lançando processos de impugnação antes de Mugabe, na terça-feira, ter anunciado a sua demissão, enquanto dezenas de milhares de zimbabuenses levaram às ruas uma manifestação apoiada por militares, pedindo a Mugabe que se afastasse do poder.
media.title: Zimbabué: Justiça diz que ações militares contra Mugabe foram constitucionais | Inforpress

media.snippet: The announcement and appointment of Ipsidy come a few months after ex-President Robert G. Mugabe resigned as president in Zimbabwe after several decades in the position. Mugabe had previously been accused of manipulating elections  to stay on as president. Ipsidy has its headquarters in New York and has operating subsidiaries in Colombia and in South Africa.
media.title: Zimbabwe will use fingerprint ID technology for its 2018 general elections – The Zimbabwe Mail

media.snippet: The Trump administration has said the sanctions will not be removed unless political reforms take place. The European Union continues an arms embargo as well as sanctions against Mr Mugabe, his wife Grace and the firm Zimbabwe Defence Industries. "We call for the unconditional lifting of the political and economic sanctions, which have crippled our national development," Mr Mnangagwa told party leaders in central Harare.
media.title: Zimbabwe's Mnangagwa seeks end to Western sanctions

media.snippet: | Новости Азербайджана В Зимбабве Расселл Горераза, приемный сын президента Роберта Мугабе, приговорен к штрафу в 800 долларов за непреднамеренное убийство человека. В феврале этого года Горераза, управляя автомобилем, сбил насмерть прохожего.
media.title: Приемный сын Мугабе получил штраф за убийство человека - ФОТО | Vesti.az | Главные новости Азербайджана | Новости Азербайджана

media.snippet: : 59 Después de un operativo lograron la detención de Gabriel R. M. de 36 años quien tenía en su poder un cuarto de libra de marihuana, además de siete paquetes ya elaborados con la misma droga los cuales tienen un valor de mil 500 pesos. La detención la realizaron en el cruce de las calles Palas y Júpiter, al momento del arresto traía una mochila y dentro de ella una bolsa grande de plástico en la cual estaba la droga mencionada.
media.title: Detuvieron a distribuidor de marihuana de la colonia Satélite | Tiempo

media.snippet: : 35 Realizaron la detención de Gabriel M. R., por su presunta responsabilidad en la comisión de los delitos de robo de vehículo con violencia en grado de tentativa y amenazas. Los agentes que realizaban su recorrido por la calle La Casta, en la colonia Parajes del Sur, observaron a dos hombres que forcejeaban a un costado de un vehículo de la marca Ford Focus, color gris, modelo 2010.
media.title: Con cuchillo en mano intentó robar auto Uber | Tiempo

media.snippet: | El padre de la menor de 15 años, víctima de violación en el municipio de Mairana, denunció que recibe amenazas de parte de los parientes cercanos del médico Robert M. G., quien está acusado por este delito y fue capturado el pasado sábado en Brasil. "Sus familiares a mí nomás me amenazan, me dicen que yo voy a ir a la cárcel, toda su familia me amenaza, quiero ayuda por favor, yo no conocía a sus parientes", dijo.
media.title: Padre de la menor violada en Mairana es víctima de amenazas y pide ayuda

media.snippet: DENUNCIA El esc ándalo de violaciones se revel ó a partir del caso de la adolescente de 15 a ños que fue violada primero por un farmac éutico y luego por un m édico. "Sus familiares a m í nom ás me amenazan, me dicen que yo voy a ir a la c árcel, toda su familia me amenaza, quiero ayuda por favor, yo no conoc ía a sus parientes", dijo.
media.title: Papá de víctima violada se declara amenazado

media.snippet: Como sucesor de "El Cachorro", La Línea designó a Roberto G. M., apodado "El Mudo" o "El 32", nombramiento que molestó a "El Cachorro" y a sus familiares radicados en la zona de Madera. En diciembre de 2016, Roberto G. M., fue detenido en la carretera Chihuahua a Juárez, pero unos días después quedó en libertad. Para finales del 2016, "El Cabo" y su gente se cambiaron de La Línea al Cartel de Sinaloa, supuestamente para apoyar a Arturo V. T., quien se sintió traicionado porque La Línea no aceptó que uno de sus familiares se quedara a cargo de la zona que él dirigía.
media.title: (no title)

media.snippet: Courtesy Chihuahua attorney general's office)CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENTEMAILMORE Chihuahua state police recently arrested two reputed drug cartel bosses, including one who allegedly offered police a bribe worth $100,000 if they would let him go, authorities said. State police arrested Roberto G.M., alias "El Mudo" , who is suspected of being the leader of a cell of La Linea, or the Juárez cartel, in the mountain town of Madera, the Chihuahua attorney general's office said. Madera is about 200 miles southwest of Juárez.
media.title: Police: Cartel suspect offered $100,000 bribe

media.snippet: 06 AMEdición impresaPUBLICIDAD Noticias en portada La Audiencia Provincial de Zaragoza condenó a un hombre a ocho años y cinco meses de prisión por elaborar, ofrecer y exhibir material pornográfico para el que utilizó a dos hermanos de 13 y 14 años con los que contactó por internet. En concreto, la Audiencia condena a Roberto M.G., de 33 años, a seis años de cárcel por el delito de elaboración de material pornográfico, a otros dos por ofrecimiento y exhibición de este tipo de material y a cinco meses por posesión de material pornográfico en el que aparecían menores. Temas relacionados
media.title: Condenado a ocho años de cárcel por pornografía infantil. eldia.es.
